intro: Cienfuegosia anomala, commonly known as the Cuban rosewood, is a small evergreen shrub native to Cuba. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dense, aromatic foliage and small, white flowers. The plant produces small, dark purple berries that are edible but not commonly consumed by humans. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in coastal areas and dry forests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in horticulture.
